column4: i have enabled all repositories, but it still doesn't show firefox as having an update...can anyone tell me why?
yes, breezy
it never will, firefox is too tightly bound to gnome for an easy repo upgrade
it's worth the effort
if you carefully follow that wiki page, you won't be able to notice that ff 1.0.7 is still around
type groups in a terminal, it'll tell you the groups you belong to
if you're not in lpadmin,  sudo adduser <you> lpadmin
a good rule of thumb: don't edit /etc/passwd or /etc/group directly
i am in lpadmin, but in localhost:631 it won't accept my username and password
do this:    sudo adduser cupsys shadow && sudo invoke-rc.d cupsys restart
it's not obvious, but necessary to use localhost:631.  After you do that, log in with your regular username & password

in xp, when i click on connect to a printer on the internet and put in 'localhost:631/printers/psc-1510' it says that windows can not connect to the printer...it never gives me a chance to put in a username or password
you have to use the exact name that ubuntu used for the printer, if I remember correctly.
I've never done it personally, just kinda watched & helped someone work his way through it months ago.
by the way, I'd throw that 1510 into a garbage bin somewhere, if I could I'd do it to mine :)
in ubuntu my printer says PSC-1510...that is what i typed into xp
u have a 1510 also?? :)
yes, unfortunately. I had to buy one 'right now' and that's what I got. and i think CAPS matter in this case
i was in the same boat.  my epson went dead without notice and was in a hurry to get another one.  i have it typed in with caps in xp...still no luck :(
I have never networked a printer with xp, so I really have no useful advice
please don't threaten us :P
thanx for ur help lastnight.  i got the printer working today :)
great
